originalText.text: I asked for no granola because I’m allergic to oats & raisins & they put oats & raisins in my food. I asked for a 20 oz & I paid $4 more than normal price for my 20oz. Instead they send the wrong thing, phone is busy called twice.. how you gonna do this to me? green juice was spilled so it wasn’t 20oz actually it was much less than 20oz. I am upset I am not happy at all don’t do something you’re going to lose business.

originalText.text:
The girl who ruined my day may your day be wonderful   You don’t even
Train the people that work with the establishment to have customer service skills on a minimum level. I’ll be embarrassed if I were you. You’re never going to get a penny of my money. You can mess up one time if you mess up 5 times you don’t have any empathy.  Show me where is the 16 ounces that you got my money for? We will report them to better business bureau for scamming I want my 16 ounce açai bowl.
I called and spoke to a girl who is very unprofessional and make excuses for her mistake. She Promise to call me back she lied .The weight of the cup alone is 2/3 of an oz. What is your problem?

originalText.text:
I was the first person in line to order a smoothie. The 2 people behind me received their smoothies before I did. Normally the staff takes forever but I can excuse it when 1 person is working, not 3. I paid and tipped the cashier. All 3 workers were taking orders and preparing orders.
I waited over 20 minutes in the hot store to receive my order. I shouldn’t have received my order after 2 people, especially since I tipped and paid over $20. My order was handed to me warm. The staff doesn’t know how to prepare a smoothie. They don’t even know when to use ripened bananas and yellow bananas. The customer service sucked. I wasn’t even given an apology for my late order. They started making the order after handing the people behind me theirs.
Please hire people who 1) know what they’re doing, and 2) are older than what seems like 16 years of age. Your staff is incompetent.

originalText.text: The juice is fresh and delicious.  The service sucks.  Four times that I have been there I feel that I am interrupting the staff from scrolling through their phone.  No smile, no nothing.  They are so upset to be in this job it seems.  The last time I waited for a few minutes for someone to show up at the counter just to tell me she is on break.  I guess that's why it's called break juicery - the staff prefers to be on break, not helping people and doing their job to make some money for the owner.  I will sadly go elsewhere for my juice.  Good luck.

originalText.text: I’ve never in my life been handed a freshly made smoothie and it be lukewarm, but that’s what happened today… on an 85 degree day. I’ve tried this place a couple of times before and it hasn’t been my favorite, but it’s close to where I live, so convenience sometimes has to factor in. In addition to the menu being pretty overpriced in my opinion (I paid $12 for a small smoothie with added protein), I was asked multiple times after I ordered what I had ordered and what size. There were three employees working and it took almost ten minutes to get my drink. I was the only one in the business that has ordered. They spent a bunch of time standing around talking after I’d ordered, then to be handed one of the worst smoothies I’ve ever had, for $12… I don’t think I’ll be returning again for another.
